VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Create an Aggregated Product

Make it easy for buyers to select a particular color, finish, size, or other characteristic of a product that comes in multiple styles. Manage the specs or other product details in one aggregated record, but specify a SKU and price for each particular style. For example, let's say that you sell a coffee press that comes in multiple finishes. You can provide a single Product Detail page where a buyer can easily select a particular finish.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Product records:	Create on CC Products
To create CC Product Media records:	Create on CC Product Media
To add a product to a price list	Create on CC Price List Items

On an aggregated product's Product Detail page, a buyer can select a style to see its unique details, such as images and price. A buyer has to select a style before they can add it to the shopping cart.

You can choose whether each style inherits the same short description from the aggregated product or has a unique short description. Maybe the aggregated product's short description applies to all your styles except one, which has a unique characteristic that you want to mention.

Create the component products for each style you want to include in the aggregated product.
Select Product from the component product's Product Type picklist.
NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't support nesting composite products. Each component product in the composite product must be a standard product type, and not another composite product.
Enter a unique SKU for the component product.
If you want a particular style to have a unique description, enter a short description for the component product. If you want the style to inherit the aggregated product's short description, leave the component product's short description blank.
If you’re using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or later, optionally select Exclude from Product Index.
NOTE When you select this option, the product isn’t included in the product index build job. As a result, the product isn't shown in search results or category results on the Product List page. The product still has a Product Detail page, and you can link to the product from a promotion or a Related Products page section.

For a composite product, maybe you want to keep the composite product available in search results, but exclude some or all of its component products. Select Exclude from Product Index on the component product records, but leave this option deselected on the composite product record.

Add unique product images for the component product.
Create a price list item and specify a price for the component product on a price list. Make sure to add all component products to the same price list.
For each component product, enter a shipping weight.
NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the component product's shipping weight to calculate shipping costs during checkout.
Create a composite product record for the aggregated product.
On the CC Products tab, create a product record.
From Product Type, select Aggregated.
Enter a unique SKU and short description for the aggregated product.
In the Shipping section, optionally enter shipping information for the aggregated product.
NOTE The aggregated product's shipping information is for display only, and isn't used to calculate shipping costs. To show the aggregated product's shipping information on the Product Detail page, create a page section.
On the aggregated product's Product Media related list, add unique images for the aggregated product. For example, add an image that shows a common style, a base version with no style, or all styles together.
Create a price list item for the aggregated product. Because the buyer's price is based on the component product they select, the aggregated product itself doesn't have a price. Enter 0 for the aggregated product's price.
Assign the component products to the aggregated product.
On the aggregated product record, scroll to the Composite Products related list, and click New.
In Component, search for a component product to add.
In Quantity, enter the component product quantity to include in the aggregated product.
NOTE If Quantity is empty for a component product, the composite product's Product Detail page doesn't show the Add to Cart button.
Enter a Sequence value.
NOTE To determine the order of selectable styles on the aggregated product's Product Detail page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares the Sequence values of all components. Lower Sequence values display first.
Save your changes, or click Save & New to add another component product.
If you're done updating product records, refresh product index records by running the product index batch jobs.
WARNING If you have more product records to update, wait to refresh product index records. Depending on the size and complexity of your product data, the batch jobs that build product index records can take a long time to complete.

When a buyer selects a style and adds it to the shopping cart, the style's component product appears as a line item in the cart. By default, the cart item's title appears as Aggregated Product - Component Product, such as Coffee Press - Stainless Steel Coffee Press. To modify the default cart item name, change the value of the Aggregate_Display page label.
